Home → New suggestions → Music → New music for March 2016

New music for March 2016

Written by Brandon King · Published Mar 1, 2016

You & I by Jeff Buckley

You & I features nine covers and two originals – Grace, which became the title track of his debut album, and the previously unheard song Dream of You and I. Among the covers are versions of Sly and The Family Stone’s Everyday People, Bob Dylan’s Just Like a Woman, and two Smiths songs, The Boy With the Thorn in His Side and I Know It’s Over. The release has been overseen by Buckley’s mother. Mary Guibert.

Chaosmosis by Primal Scream

Bobby Gillespie and co return with a follow-up to 2013’s More Light. The new album is released on the band’s own First International label.

Girl at the end of the world by James

James release their tricky 14th album. Led as ever by singer and lyricist Tim Booth, the Manchester veterans have teamed up with producer Max Dingel, who has The Killers and Muse as past credits. Brian Eno is also on there too, just as he was in 1993 on James’s most experimental album, Wah Wah.

Barbara, Barbara we face a shining future by Underworld

First new material from the electronic duo since Barking in 2010.

Distance inbetween by The Coral

After five years away indie band The Coral return. First single, Chasing the Tail of a Dream, was released in December.

Know-It-All by Alessia Cara

Runner-up to Jack Garratt for the BBC Music Sound of… award for 2016, Alessia is a silky voiced Canadian singer who has drawn comparisons with Norah Jones.

Ouroboros by Ray Lamontagne

Grammy Award winner, Ray Lamontagne releases his sixth studio album, produced by Ray and Jim James of My Morning Jacket. The album features the single, Hey, No Pressure.

Brandon King

I work in the Suffolk Libraries Stock Team
